name: ORI NUMBER
definition: NCIC originating agency identifier number.

name: INCIDENT NUMBER
definition: Agency unique, in-house assigned case number
comment: The Incident Number should contain the current year as part of it when possible to prevent duplication/reuse of incident numbers across different years.

name: INCIDENT DATE/HOUR
definition: Date and Time when the incident occurred or started, or at the beginning of the time period in which it occurred, or date of report if unknown

name: CLEARED EXCEPTIONALLY
definition: Indicates whether the incident was cleared exceptionally. Clearance of one offense clears the entire incident.
comment: For Code O (Other) - LIBRS Only, Does not clear NIBRS Incident

name: EXCEPTIONAL CLEARANCE DATE
definition: When the incident was cleared, if cleared by exceptional means.

name: OFFENSE SEQUENCE NUMBER
definition: Each Offense within the incident MUST be assigned a sequence number.
comment: Each Offense within an incident MUST be assigned a UNIQUE Offense Sequence Number.

name: OFFENSE SEQUENCE NUMBER REFERENCES
definition: **NEW** UNIQUE constraint that allows an Offense to relate to many Properties.
comment: Important: Internal system data element that allows for an Offense to relate to many properties where multiple Property/Offense segments are submitted within a single incident.

name: LOUISIANA REVISED STATUTE NUMBER (LRS Number)
definition: Each Offense (LRS) that occurred as part of the incident.
comment: MUST be in Master LIBRS/LRS Code Table to be accepted by LIBRS. Note: Contact LIBRS Program staff before adding new LRS codes to insure proper mappings.

name: AGENCY SUPPLIED NIBRS CODE
definition: NIBRS Code assigned to every Offense within an incident.
comment: Agencies should be aware that many Louisiana Revised Statutes map to multiple NIBRS codes. Please consult the LIBRS Master LRS Table to review these mappings and contact LIBRS Program Staff if you have questions.

name: OFFENSE ATTEMPTED/COMPLETED
definition: Indicates whether each Offense was completed or merely attempted.
comment: Agencies should be aware that many Louisiana Revised Statutes map to multiple NIBRS codes. Please consult the LIBRS Master LRS Table to review these mappings and contact LIBRS Program Staff if you have questions.

name: OFFENDER SUSPECTED OF USING/GAMING MOTIVATION
definition:
Indicates if the Offender was suspected of consuming alcohol or using drugs/narcotics during or shortly before the incident; or of using a computer to perpetrate the crime.

Also identifies whether the Offender’s gaming activity was the motive for commission of the crime.
comment:
This Data Element is located within Offender Segment.

Can enter up to four codes per Offender.

name: BIAS MOTIVATION/BIAS CRIME TYPE
definition: Indicates whether the Offender was motivated to commit the Offense because of his/her bias against a racial, religious, ethnic/national origin, sexual, or disability group.

values.desc: Anti-Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Anti-Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual or Transgender (Mixed Group)

comment:
These codes are presented for Legacy Reference for old data and should no longer be used.

The data element is located within Offender Segment.

name: LOCATION TYPE
definition: Location where each Offense took place.

values.desc: Bank, Savings and Loan (incl. other Financial Institutions)
Church, Synagogue or Temple (includes other Religious Buildings..)
Drug Store, Doctor's Office or Hospital (includes Medical Supply Building)
Specialty Store (incl. Fur Store, Jewelry Store, TV Store, Dress Shop, etc.)
Other or Unknown (use only if no other code applies)
Dock, Wharf, Freight or Modal Terminal
Gambling Facility, Casino or Race Track

comment:
These codes are presented for Legacy Reference for old data and should no longer be used.

The data element is located within Offense Segment.

Note: Data value School (22) was replaced by Location Codes 52 and 53 and is to be used only by agencies that have not adopted the new codes

name: NUMBER OF PREMISES ENTERED
definition: Number of structures entered.
comment: Used only if crime is Burglary (220) AND if the Hotel Rule is applicable. Also, Location Type (Data Element No. 9) MUST be Hotel/Motel (14) or Jail/Prison (19)

name: METHOD OF ENTRY
definition: Indicates whether Force or No Force was used by the burglar in entering a structure
comment: Used only if crime is Burglary (220).

name: TYPE OF CRIMINAL ACTIVITY/GANG INFORMATION
definition: Provides additional information on the criminal activity and gang information of the Offender.
comment:
For Type of Criminal Activity, use ONLY if one of the following Offenses:
  • 250 - Counterfeiting/Forgery
  • 280 - Stolen Property Offenses
  • 35A & 35B - Drug/Narcotic Offenses
  • 39C - Gambling Equip. Violations
  • 370 - Pornography Materials
  • 520 - Weapons Law Violations
  • 90A - Bad Checks
  • 90Z - 'Crime Against Property' Offenses
  • 720 - Animal Cruelty
Note: Can enter up to THREE codes of TYPE OF CRIMINAL ACTIVITY for each offense. Codes A, F, I and S may only be used for 720 Animal Cruelty Offenses.

For Gang Information, use only if the crime is one of the following offenses codes of “J”, ” G”, or ”N”:
  • 09A - Murder and Nonnegligent Manslaughter
  • 09B - Negligent Homicide
  • 100 - Kidnaping or Abduction
  • 120 - Robbery
  • 11A - Forcible Rape
  • 11B - Forcible Sodomy
  • 11C - Sexual Assault with An Object
  • 11D - Forcible Fondling
  • 13A - Aggravated Assault
  • 13B - Simple Assault
  • 13C - Intimidation
Note: Can enter up to TWO codes of GANG INFORMATION for each offense.

values.desc: Possession with Intent to Sell. Sent to NIBRS as code 'P'
Other. Sent to NIBRS as code 'P'

name: TYPE OF WEAPON/FORCE INVOLVED
definition: The type(s) of weapon(s), or force, used by the Offender in committing the Offense.
comment:
Use this data element ONLY if crime is one of the following Offenses: {::nomarkdown}
  • 09A, 09B, 09C Homicide Offenses
  • 100 Kidnaping or Abduction
  • 11A, 11B, 11C, 11D Forcible Sex Offenses
  • 120 Robbery
  • 13A Assault Offenses
  • 64A Human Trafficking and Commercial Sex Acts
  • 64B Human Trafficking and Involuntary Servitude
  • 210 Extortion/Blackmail
  • 520 Weapon Law Violations
{:/}

If weapon is an Automatic Weapon (capable of continued fire if the trigger is held down), append an 'A' to the weapon code as a third character.

values.desc: Motor Vehicle / Vessel (When used as a weapon)
None (Mutually Exclusive to any other value)

name: PROPERTY SEQUENCE NUMBER
definition: Each Property in the Incident MUST be assigned a UNIQUE Sequence Number.
comment: Important: Internal system data element that allows for a Property to relate to many Offenses where multiple Property/Offense segments are submitted within a single incident.

name: PROPERTY SEQUENCE NUMBER REFERENCE
definition: UNIQUE constraint that allows a Property to relate to many Offenses.
comment: Important: Internal system data element that allows for multiple Property/Offense segments to be submitted within a single Incident.

name: TYPE OF PROPERTY LOSS
definition: Describes the type of property loss, recovered, seized, etc., which occurred in an incident.
comment: Property segments submitted only if crime is:

name: PROPERTY DESCRIPTION
definition: Description of property that was burned, counterfeited, stolen, etc., during the incident.
comment: ‘99’ CANNOT be used unless state programs are directed to use it for trend crimes by the FBI and will be rejected if used normal submissions.

values.desc: Special category used by the National UCR program to compile statistics.

name: VALUE OF PROPERTY
definition: The total dollar value of the property burned, counterfeited, stolen, etc., during and incident
comment: Values are also entered for Seized Drugs and Narcotics. (LIBRS Only)

name: DATE RECOVERED
comment: If previously stolen property is recovered, the date of its recovery is to be entered. If there are more than one recovery dates for the same 'Property Description' enter the earliest date. If the recovery date is Unknown, enter the date of the report.

name: NUMBER OF STOLEN MOTOR VEHICLES
definition: Indicates number of motor vehicles stolen during an incident. If the number is Unknown, enter '00'.
comment: MUST BE ENTERED if NIBRS Offense Code is 240. Otherwise, MUST BE BLANK.

name: NUMBER OF RECOVERED VEHICLES
definition: Indicates how many motor vehicles were recovered in the incident. If the number is unknown, enter '00'.
comment: MUST BE ENTERED if NIBRS Offense Code is 240. Otherwise, MUST BE BLANK.

name: SUSPECTED DRUG TYPE
definition: Enter the types of drugs/narcotics that were seized in a drug case.

values.desc: Hash Oil (LIBRS Only). Sent to NIBRS as “C”

Other Narcotics:
  • Codeine
  • Demerol
  • Dihydromorphinone or Dilaudid
  • Hydrocodone or Percodan
  • Methadone

Other Hallucinogens:
  • BMDA or 'White Acid'
  • MT, MDA, or MDMA
  • Mescaline or Peyote
  • Psilocybin
  • STP

Other Stimulants:
  • Adipex, Fastine, and Ionamin (Derivatives of Phentermine)
  • Benzedrine
  • Didrex
  • Methylphenidate or Ritalin
  • Phenmetrazine or Preludin
  • Tenuate

Other Depressants:
  • Glutethimide or Doriden
  • Methaqualone or Quaalude
  • Pentazocine or Talwin

Other Drugs:
  • Antidepressants (Elavil, Triavil, Tofranil, Etc.)
  • Aromatic Hydrocarbons
  • Propoxyphene or Darvon
  • Tranquilizers (Chlordiazepoxide or Librium, Diazepam or Valium, Etc.)

comment: If the suspected drug type is a counterfeit, append an 'X' to the drug code, otherwise leave the second character blank.

name: ESTIMATED DRUG QUANTITY
definition: The quantity of drugs or narcotics seized in a drug incident.
comment: If Drug Quantity is UNKNOWN, then value should be 1.000

name: TYPE OF DRUG MEASUREMENT
definition: Used in quantifying drugs or narcotics seized in a drug incident. The same drugs or narcotics code CANNOT be entered within the same “Type of Measurement” category, but could be reported if in different categories.
comment:
For example, if two one-pound bags of marijuana are seized, they CANNOT be reported as two separate property seizures of one pound each, but instead should be reported as one seizure of two pounds of marijuana.

On the other hand, if a one-pound bag and a three-ounce bag of marijuana are seized, then they should be reported separately as a one-pound bag and a three-ounce bag.



Note: XX = should be used for any category of drug when the substance is awaiting lab analysis

values.desc: Dosage Units, Items (Number of Capsules, Pills, Tablets, Etc.)
Number of Plants (e.g., Marijuana Plants (Bushes), Etc.)

name: VICTIM SEQUENCE NUMBER
definition: Each victim in an incident is to be assigned a sequence number.

name: OFFENSE CONNECTED TO VICTIM SEQUENCE NUMBER
definition: Used to link each offense to each victim. That is, the offense       which was perpetrated against the victim during the incident.
comment:
Must have an offense segment for each victim. (e.g. 3 rape victims) Even though the same LRS was violated during the incident, this LRS code must be submitted for each victim. One offense segment of 14:42/ V must be submitted for each victim.

Note: This Data Element is in the Offense Segment.

name: TYPE OF VICTIM
definition: The type of victim.

values.desc: Law Enforcement Officer (LIBRS Only). Sent to NIBRS as “L” starting with 2.5

name: TYPE OF OFFICER ACTIVITY/CIRCUMSTANCE *New*
definition: Describes Activity being performed by a Law Enforcement Officer, and Other Circumstances, at time of the Incident.

values.desc: Burglaries in Progress or Pursuing Burglary Suspects
Robberies in Progress or Pursuing Robbery Suspects

name: OFFICER ASSIGNMENT TYPE *NEW*
definition: Describes Type of Assignment for Law Enforcement Officer(s) during Incident.

name: OFFICER ORI, OTHER JURISDICTION *New*
definition: During a Multi-Jurisdictional Incident, this ORI Number is recorded if a Law Enforcement Officer who is the Victim is from a Jurisdiction outside the Jurisdiction where the Incident occurred.
comment: Format: Same as Agency ORI Number. If the ORI Number is unknown please contact LIBRS Program staff for assistance.

name: AGE OF VICTIM (At Time of the Incident)
comment:
If the victim was a person (that is, Type of Victim (Data Element 25) is Individual ('I') or Law Enforcement ('L'), then his/her age is to be entered into this data element.

If the Victim's EXACT AGE IS UNKNOWN, enter estimated age of Victim and append an 'E' into third character (for example, '49E'). If it is impossible to determine even an estimated age of the victim, then enter Unknown ('00') and leave the third character blank.

name: DATE OF BIRTH OF VICTIM
definition: If the Victim was a person (that is, Type of Victim (Data Element 25) is Individual (“I”) or Law Enforcement ('L')), then his/her Date of Birth should be entered here.

name: SEX OF VICTIM
definition: If the victim was a person (that is, Type of Victim (Data Element 25) is Individual ('I') or Law Enforcement ('L')), then his/her sex should be entered here.

name: RACE OF VICTIM
definition: If the victim was a person (that is, Type of Victim (Data Element 25) is Individual (“I”) or Law Enforcement ('L'), then his/her Race is to be entered into this data element.

values.desc: Native Hawiian or Other Pacific Islander

name: ETHNICITY OF VICTIM
definition: If the victim was a person (i.e., 'I'= Individual or 'L' = Law Enforcement was entered into DE # 25 “Type of Victim”), his/her ethnicity is to be entered into this data element.

name: RESIDENT STATUS OF VICTIM
definition: A 'Resident' is a person who maintains his/her permanent home for legal purposes in the locality (i.e., town, city, or community) where the crime took place.
comment: If the victim was a person (i.e., 'I'= Individual or 'L' = Law Enforcement was entered into DE # 25 “Type of Victim”), his/her resident status is to be entered into this data element.

name: AGGRAVATED ASSAULT / HOMICIDE CIRCUMSTANCE *Modified*
definition: Describes the circumstances of either an Aggravated Assault or Homicide
comment:
Use ONLY if Crime is: Homicide (09A, 09B or 09C), Assault Offenses (13A or 13B) only when the 13B Victim is a ‘L’ and Law Enforcement Officer.

Child Abuse (“40”) can ONLY be used when Offenses are: Murder and Nonnegligent Manslaughter (09A), Negligent Homicide (09B), Aggravated Assault (13A)

subsection.title: Aggravated Assault and Non-Negligent Manslaughter Circumstances

values.desc: Mercy Killing (Not applicable to aggravated assault)
Child Abuse (LIBRS Only) to NIBRS as code '09'
Child Abuse (LIBRS Only) to NIBRS as code '09'

name: ADDITIONAL JUSTIFIABLE HOMICIDE CIRCUMSTANCES
definition: Used to further describe the circumstances of a justifiable homicide, and homicide, or assault, against a law enforcement officer
comment: Enter ONLY ONE of the following codes

values.desc: Criminal Attacked Police Officer and That Officer Killed Criminal
Criminal Attacked Police Officer and Criminal Killed by Another Police Officer
Criminal Attempted Flight from a Crime
Criminal Killed in the Commission of a Crime
Unable to Determine / Not Enough Information

name: TYPE OF INJURY
definition: Describes types of bodily injury suffered by a person.
comment:
Used only if Crime is: (100)Kidnaping/Abduction, (11A-11D)Forcible Sex Offenses, (120)Robbery, (13A,13B)Assault Offenses, (210)Extortion/Blackmail and (90Z)Crime Against Person Offenses.

Can enter as many codes as are applicable

name: OFFENDER NUMBER TO BE RELATED
definition: Used along with Relationship of Victim to Offender (Data Element 35) to report the relationships of each Victim to each Offender who has perpetrated a Crime against a Person or a Robbery against the Victim(Individual).
comment: Used only if Crime is: (09A, 09B, 09C) Homicide Offenses, (100) Kidnaping/Abduction, (11A-11D) Forcible Sex Offenses, (120) Robbery, (13A,13B,13C) Assault Offenses, (36A,36B) Non-Forcible Sex Offenses and (90Z) Crime Against Person Offenses

name: RELATIONSHIP OF VICTIM TO OFFENDERS
definition: Used along with Offender Number to be Related (Data Element 34) to report the relationships of each Victim to each Offender who has perpetrated a Crime against a Person or a Robbery against the Victim (Individual).

values.desc: Non-Married Live-in (LIBRS Only) Sent to NIBRS as 'CS'

subsection.title: Outside Family, But Known to Victim

values.desc: Victim Was Ex-Boyfriend/Girlfriend (LIBRS Only). Now Maps to 'XR'; Sent to NIBRS as 'BG'
Victim Was Child of Boyfriend or Girlfriend
Victim Was Estranged Spouse (LIBRS Only) Sent to NIBRS as 'SE'
Victim was from an Ex Relationship

subsection.title: Other
subsection.comment: Used only if Crime is: (09A,09B,09C) Homicide Offenses, (100) Kidnaping/Abduction, (11A-11D) Forcible Sex Offenses, (120) Robbery (If Victim Type = 'I'), (13A,13B,13C) Assault Offenses, (36A,36B) Non-Forcible Sex Offenses and (90Z) Crime Against Person Offenses

name: OFFENDER SEQUENCE NUMBER
definition: Each Offender in an incident is assigned a UNIQUE sequence number
comment:
If '000' entered (that is, nothing is known about Offender) leave Age of Offender, Date of Birth of Offender, Sex of Offender and Race of Offender (Data Elements 37-39) Blank

000...Nothing Known About Offender. However, must submit Offender Segment (40) and Offender Using Segment (41), even if Offender is Unknown.

name: AGE OF OFFENDER [At Time of the Incident]
comment:
If Offender’s exact age is Unknown, enter estimated age of Offender and append an 'E' into third character (for example: 49E).

If it is not possible to determine even an estimated age of the Offender, then enter '00' (Unknown) and leave the third character Blank

name: DATE OF BIRTH OF OFFENDER
comment: If the date of birth of the offender is known, it is to be entered in this data element.

name: SEX OF OFFENDER
definition: The sex of the Offender is to be entered in this data element.

name: RACE OF OFFENDER
definition: The race of the Offender is to be entered in this data element.

name: ETHNICITY OF OFFENDER
definition: (Optional) The Ethnicity of the Offender is to be entered in this data element.

name: ARRESTEE SEQUENCE NUMBER
definition: Each Arrestee in an incident is to be assigned a sequence number

name: ARRESTEE NAME
definition: Enter the full name of Arrestee. If the full name will not fit in the field, enter as much as possible

name: ARREST NUMBER/LOCAL BOOKING NUMBER for ARREST
definition: The number assigned by your agency to the Arrest Report to identify it uniquely. It may be the Incident Number of the reported incident relating to the arrest, or a separate Arrest Transaction Number.

name: ARREST DATE
definition: The month, date, and year when the arrest took place

name: TYPE OF ARREST
definition: Indicates the type of apprehension

values.desc: On-View Arrest (taken into custody without a warrant or previous incident report.)
Taken Into Custody (based on warrant and/or previously submitted incident report.)

name: MULTIPLE ARRESTEE SEGMENT INDICATOR
definition: Used to ensure that an arrestee is counted only once when the arrestee’s apprehension causes the arresting agency to submit two or more arrestee segments concerning separate incident reports

name: LOUISIANA REVISED STATUTE NUMBER OF ARREST
definition: Used to enter the Louisiana Revised Statute Number(s) that the arrestee was charged with
comment: Must be on Master LIBRS/LRS Code Table to be accepted into LIBRS.

name: AGENCY SUPPLIED NIBRS CODE FOR ARREST *NEW*
comment: EVERY Offense Segment (20) in the data submission MUST have an Agency Supplied NIBRS Code (N6). Agencies should be aware that many Louisiana Revised Statutes map to multiple NIBRS codes and should consult the LIBRS Master LRS Table to review these mappings.

name: ARREST CONNECTION TO OFFENSE
definition: Used to relate the arrest with the offense which gave rise to the arrest
comment: This Data Element is optional at this time.

name: ARRESTEE WAS ARMED WITH
definition: Used to indicate whether the arrestee was armed with a commonly known weapon at the time of his/her apprehension
comment:
Append an 'A' to the Weapon code if an Automatic Weapon. (That is, place an 'A' in third character)

Can enter as many codes as are applicable.

values.desc: Lethal Cutting Instrument (switchblade knife, martial arts 'stars', Etc.)

name: AGE OF ARRESTEE [At Time of Arrest]
definition: The age of the Arrestee at the time of arrest is to be entered
comment: If the Arrestee’s exact age is UNKNOWN, enter Estimated Age of Arrestee and Append an 'E' into third character (for example, “49E”). If it is not possible to determine even an Estimated Age of the Arrestee, then enter '00' (Unknown) and leave the third character blank

name: DATE OF BIRTH OF ARRESTEE
definition: If the Date of Birth of the Arrestee is known, entered it in this data element.

name: SEX OF ARRESTEE
definition: Enter Sex of the Arrestee in this data element.

name: RACE OF ARRESTEE
definition: Enter Race of the Arrestee in this data element.

name: ETHNICITY OF ARRESTEE
definition: Enter Ethnic Origin of the Arrestee in this data element.

name: RESIDENT STATUS OF ARRESTEE
definition: A 'Resident' is a person who maintains his or her permanent home for legal purposes in the locality (town, city, or community) where the crime took place.
comment: Enter Resident Status of the Arrestee in this data element.

name: DISPOSITION OF ARRESTEE UNDER 18
definition: Used only if the arrestee was 16 years of age or younger at the time of arrest.

values.desc: Referred to Juvenile Court or Probation Department
Referred to Criminal or Adult Court

name: LOCATION OF INCIDENT (Geographical Coordinates)
definition: This field is for reporting the Geographical Location of the incident.
comment:
This field is NOT REQUIRED and may be left Blank.

Optional: This field is not validated nor submitted to the FBI.

name: STATION/DIVISION/PRECINCT IDENTIFIER
definition: OPTIONAL field for Agency’s use in locating incidents.
comment: Optional

name: ARREST TRANSACTION NUMBER (ATN) for LOUISIANA
definition: This data element will be generated by the Live Scan when finger printing an Arrestee, or can be a Pre-Assigned Number generated and assigned at the time of the finger printing
comment: Based on characters as assigned by AFIS. Required on all Offenses reported to the Bureau of Identification of the Louisiana State Police.

name: INCHOATE
definition: The Inchoate value is designed to give extra context to the nature of the offense.
comment: Optional
